personal.name: Praveen Kumar G
personal.title: Former Senior Software Engineer
personal.bio: I’m Praveen Kumar Gangapuram, a Senior Software Engineer and CS grad student at SUNY Buffalo. I build full-stack AI-driven apps using Next.js, NestJS, FastAPI, and Docker. With 500+ DSA problems solved, I combine strong algorithmic skills with scalable, cloud-native development.
longBio: I'm a Former Senior Software Engineer and graduate student in Computer Science at the State University of New York at Buffalo. I specialize in building full-stack web applications and intelligent systems that integrate deep learning, natural language processing, and modern cloud-native technologies.

With hands-on experience in frameworks like Next.js, NestJS, and FastAPI, I’ve designed and deployed scalable solutions across domains including health tech, ed-tech, and real-time analytics. My projects often leverage LLMs (like DistilGPT-2), RESTful APIs, WebSockets, and microservices—all containerized using Docker and orchestrated via CI/CD pipelines on platforms like AWS, DigitalOcean, and Linode.

I’ve automated enterprise workflows using the Microsoft Power Platform, saving teams dozens of hours per week, and consistently delivered robust backend systems and user-friendly interfaces. I’ve also authored 75+ competitive programming problems, solved over 500 algorithmic challenges, and believe in writing clean, maintainable code that scales with user needs.
I’m passionate about solving real-world problems through software and constantly seek to learn, collaborate, and push the boundaries of what intelligent systems can do.

experience.title: Senior Software Engineer
experience.description: Led full-stack development of enterprise CRM applications using React, Power Platform, C#, and JavaScript. Built dynamic Power Pages portals integrated with internal APIs and custom workflows. Automated internal operations using Power Automate, saving 40+ hours weekly. Developed reusable REST modules to accelerate backend service integration. Collaborated with cross-functional teams to ensure scalable and maintainable solutions.

experience.title: Software Engineer I
experience.description: Developed CRM portals using React, NestJS, and Power Platform for business automation. Built modular and high-performance UI components, reducing page load time by 30%. Integrated backend services using C#/Node.js and secured third-party SaaS APIs. Followed agile methodology and worked closely with designers and QA teams. Contributed to scalable backend API development and optimized database operations.

experience.title: Associate Software Engineer
experience.description: Developed low-code Power Apps optimized for mobile and desktop using embedded HTML/JavaScript. Maintained legacy jQuery frontends and C#-based RESTful services. Participated in bug fixing, performance tuning, and UI enhancements. Gained hands-on experience with agile sprints and daily stand-ups. Supported client requirements through quick turnarounds and detailed documentation.

experience.title: Programming Problems Curator
experience.description: Created and published over 75 advanced coding problems focused on data structures and algorithms. Topics covered included trees, graphs, recursion, and dynamic programming. Built a MEAN-stack tool to scrape HackerEarth leaderboards and analyze coder performance. Developed a rating engine using ELO-based scoring logic. Supported the platform’s growth by reviewing submissions and maintaining test cases.

Developed multiple projects integrating LLMs and scalable backend services. Actively involved in academic coding challenges and collaborative research. Strengthened foundations in algorithms, system design, and deployment pipelines.

Built early versions of quiz and leaderboard platforms using MEAN stack. Organized coding events and authored 75+ competitive problems. Gained hands-on experience in full-stack development and REST API integration.

projects.description: A medical diagnostic tool using a CNN trained on ChestMNIST to predict X-ray outcomes. Deployed with FastAPI backend, Docker containers, and CI/CD pipeline on DigitalOcean. Offers accurate predictions via a clean NextJS frontend.

projects.title: FilmRaft
projects.description: A digital film archive platform with admin review tools and WebSocket-based donor chat. Full-stack build using React, NextJS, NestJS, PostgreSQL, and Docker. Automated deployment on Linode with real-time chat and approval workflows.

Built using NextJS, NestJS, and PostgreSQL with containerized deployment via Docker and CI/CD. Supports multilingual code execution, secure authentication, and scalable contest tracking.

blogPosts.title: Deploying a Deep Learning Model to a Web Server
blogPosts.excerpt: A step-by-step guide on deploying a deep learning model trained on the ChestMNIST dataset using FastAPI, Docker, Next.js, and DigitalOcean.
blogPosts.content:
Deploying deep learning models to production requires combining machine learning with solid web development practices. In this guide, I walk through deploying a CNN trained on the ChestMNIST dataset—achieving 94% accuracy—to a live web server using FastAPI, Docker, and DigitalOcean.

The architecture consists of:
Frontend: Built with Next.js for uploading chest X-ray images.
Backend: Implemented with FastAPI to process images and return predictions.
Model: A trained deep learning model in `.pth` format.
NGINX: Configured as a reverse proxy for routing traffic securely.
Deployment: Managed through Docker and hosted on DigitalOcean using Docker Compose.

Deployment Steps:
1. Set Up GitHub Repository: Created folders for `frontend`, `backend`, and `nginx`.
2. Frontend with Next.js: Used `npm run dev` to start the app; built UI to handle image uploads.
3. Backend with FastAPI: Loaded the model and exposed an endpoint to accept images and return disease probabilities.
4. Dockerize Each Service: Wrote Dockerfiles for frontend, backend, and NGINX to automate server-side setups.
5. Compose with Docker Compose: Unified the stack using `docker-compose.yml`.
6. Deploy Locally: Verified everything runs on `localhost` with `docker-compose up --build`.
7. Deploy to Cloud (DigitalOcean): Created a Droplet. Set up SSH key authentication. Cloned the GitHub repo. Installed Docker. Ran the build and started services.

Accessing the deployed app via the droplet's public IP address confirms the full stack deployment.

This approach showcases how AI solutions can be productized using modern web tools and containerization. It ensures scalability, reliability, and a smooth user experience from model training to real-time inference.

blogPosts.title: Building FilmRaft: A Real-Time Digital Archive Platform
blogPosts.excerpt: Explore how FilmRaft enables real-time interaction between donors, admins, and viewers using WebSockets, Docker, and a scalable full-stack architecture.
blogPosts.content:
FilmRaft is a full-stack digital archive platform designed to manage, review, and publish community-submitted film content. It enables seamless, real-time communication between donors and admins using modern web technologies and scalable infrastructure.

The platform architecture includes:
  Frontend: Built using React and Next.js for fast, responsive user interfaces.
  Backend: Developed with NestJS and PostgreSQL for structured data handling and API orchestration.
  WebSocket: Enables real-time tri-party chat between donors, admins, and moderators.
  Deployment: Containerized with Docker and orchestrated using GitHub Actions for CI/CD.

Development Highlights:
  Built user role-based dashboard where admins can review and approve film submissions.
  Integrated WebSocket channels to allow instant messaging between stakeholders.
  Designed a secure REST API layer for handling submissions, feedback, and chat history.
  Configured Dockerfiles for frontend and backend with a shared custom network.
  Automated deployment to Linode using GitHub Actions and Docker Compose for zero-downtime updates.

The result is a platform that supports rich media collaboration while maintaining performance, security, and scalability. FilmRaft demonstrates how modern JavaScript frameworks combined with real-time communication protocols can power next-gen content platforms.
